first_premise: Luke is spending time at the beach building sandcastles. Luke eventually notices that each level of a sandcastle will have half the square footage as the level below it.
alternate_first_premise: Luke is spending time at the beach building sandcastles. Luke eventually notices that each level of a sandcastle will have double the square footage as the level below it.
nl_premises: Luke makes a 4 leveled sandcastle. The top level of the sandcastle that Luke makes has a square footage of 16.
nl_question: What is the average square footage of a level of the sandcastle?
nl_answer: The average square footage of a level of Luke's sandcastle is 60 square feet.
wrong_nl_answer: The average square footage of a level of Luke's sandcastle is 80 square feet.

first_premise: Cecilia just bought a new puppy. According to her veterinarian, Cecilia has to feed the puppy 1 cup of dog food every day for the first 180 days.
alternate_first_premise: Cecilia just bought a new puppy. According to her veterinarian, Cecilia has to feed the puppy 2 cups of dog food every day for the first 180 days.
nl_premises: After 180 days, Cecilia has to feed the puppy 2 cups of dog food every day for the rest of its life. One bag of dog food contains 110 cups.
nl_question: How many bags of dog food will Cecilia use in the first year?
nl_answer: Cecilia will use 5 bags of dog food in the first year.
wrong_nl_answer: Cecilia will use 4 bags of dog food in the first year.

first_premise: Jeremy adopts a dog.  He takes the dog to the groomer, which costs $100.
alternate_first_premise: Jeremy adopts a dog.  He takes the dog to the groomer, which costs $90.
nl_premises: The groomer offers him a 30% discount for being a new customer.
nl_question: How much does the grooming cost?
nl_answer: The grooming costs 70 dollars.
wrong_nl_answer: The grooming costs 50 dollars.

first_premise: Two girls each got 1/6 of the 24 liters of water.
alternate_first_premise: Two girls each got 1/6 of the 18 liters of water.
nl_premises: After the two girls got water, a boy got 6 liters of water.
nl_question: How many liters of water were left after the two girls and the boy got water?
nl_answer: There were 10 liters of water left after the two girls and the boy got water.
wrong_nl_answer: There were 7 liters of water left after the two girls and the boy got water.

first_premise: Christopher had 10 stickers.
alternate_first_premise: Christopher had 12 stickers.
nl_premises: Christopher bought 21 stickers from a store in the mall and got 23 stickers for his birthday. Then Christopher gave 9 of the stickers to his sister and used 28 to decorate a greeting card.
nl_question: How many stickers does Christopher have left?
nl_answer: Christopher has 17 stickers left.
wrong_nl_answer: Christopher has 19 stickers left.

first_premise: Grace weighs 125 pounds.
alternate_first_premise: Grace weighs 100 pounds.
nl_premises: Alex weighs 2 pounds less than 4 times what Grace weighs.
nl_question: What is the combined weight of Grace and Alex in pounds?
nl_answer: The combined weight of Alex and Grace is 623 pounds.
wrong_nl_answer: The combined weight of Alex and Grace is 613 pounds.

first_premise: Dan plants 3 rose bushes.
alternate_first_premise: Dan plants 2 rose bushes.
nl_premises: Each rose bush Dan plants has 25 roses. Each rose on Dan's rose bushes has 8 thorns.
nl_question: How many thorns are there total on all of Dan's roses?
nl_answer: There are 600 thorns in total on all of Dan's roses.
wrong_nl_answer: There are 650 thorns in total on all of Dan's roses.

first_premise: Gene is sewing a quilt out of old souvenir t-shirts. Gene has one shirt from each vacation he has been on.
alternate_first_premise: Gene is sewing a quilt out of old souvenir t-shirts. Gene has two shirts from each vacation he has been on.
nl_premises: Every shirt Gene makes is its own quilt block. Each row of the quilt Gene makes is made of blocks from a different year of vacations. Gene goes on four vacations a year and has been vacationing since he was 23 years old. Gene is now 34.
nl_question: How many quilt blocks does Gene have in total?
nl_answer: Gene has 44 quilt blocks in total.
wrong_nl_answer: Gene has 42 quilt blocks in total.

first_premise: Greg has an alarm set to ring three times a day as a reminder. When the alarm goes off, it continues to ring until Greg turns it off. The first time Greg's alarm went off today, it rang four times.
alternate_first_premise: Greg has an alarm set to ring three times a day as a reminder. When Greg's alarm goes off, it continues to ring until Greg turns it off. The first time Greg's alarm went off today, it rang two times.
nl_premises: The second time Greg's alarm went off, it rang for three times as long as the first time. The third time Greg's alarm went off, it rang for half as long as the second time.
nl_question: How many times did Greg's alarm ring in all?
nl_answer: Greg's alarm rang 22 times in all.
wrong_nl_answer: Greg's alarm rang 24 times in all.

first_premise: Marilyn's first record sold 10 times as many copies as Harald's.
alternate_first_premise: Marilyn's first record sold 20 times as many copies as Harald's.
nl_premises: Marilyn and Harald sold 88000 copies combined.
nl_question: How many copies did Harald sell?
nl_answer: Harald sold 8000 copies.
wrong_nl_answer: Harald sold 18000 copies.

first_premise: Christina is planning a birthday party and needs .75 gift bags per invited guest, because 1/4 of attendees don't show up. Christina invited 16 friends.
alternate_first_premise: Christina is planning a birthday party and needs .75 gift bags per invited guest, because 1/4 of attendees don't show up. Christina invited 20 friends.
nl_premises: Gift bags cost $2 each.
nl_question: How much will Christina spend on gift bags?
nl_answer: Christina will spend 24 dollars on gift bags.
wrong_nl_answer: Christina will spend 22 dollars on gift bags.

first_premise: Ted the T-Rex was planning to bring potato salad to the dinosaur picnic.  Ted knows that an adult dinosaur will eat 10 lbs of potato salad, and a child will eat half as much as an adult.
alternate_first_premise: Ted the T-Rex was planning to bring potato salad to the dinosaur picnic.  Ted knows that an adult dinosaur will eat 8 lbs of potato salad, and a child will eat half as much as an adult.
nl_premises: There will be 20 adults and 5 children at the dinosaur picnic.
nl_question: How many pounds of potato salad does Ted need to bring to the picnic if he hopes to have enough to feed everyone?
nl_answer: Ted needs to bring 225 pounds of potato salad.
wrong_nl_answer: Ted needs to bring 175 pounds of potato salad.

first_premise: Jan has three times the number of pets as Marcia.
alternate_first_premise: Jan has four times the number of pets as Marcia.
nl_premises: Marcia has two more pets than Cindy. Cindy has four pets.
nl_question: How many total pets do Jan, Marcia, and Cindy have total?
nl_answer: Jan, Marcia, and Cindy have a total of 28 pets.
wrong_nl_answer: Jan, Marcia, and Cindy have a total of 32 pets.

first_premise: Emily has 4 kids named Amy, Jackson, Corey, and Jason. Amy is 5 years older than Jackson and 2 years younger than Corey.
alternate_first_premise: Emily has 4 kids named Amy, Jackson, Corey, and Jason. Amy is 6 years older than Jackson and 2 years younger than Corey.
nl_premises: Jason is 10. Jason is 1 year younger than Corey.
nl_question: How old is Jackson?
nl_answer: Jackson is 4 years old.
wrong_nl_answer: Jackson is 5 years old.
